result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Valangel Malorie Stinson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Request to Reschedule 12-19-22 Hearing - Reschedule request APPROVED by Judge

Defendant Valangel Malorie Stinson in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Christensen in court for Valangel Malorie Stinson.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
3:07 p.m.
Copy of Information.
Waives reading.
Enters not guilty pleas.
3:09 p.m.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Valangel Malorie Stinson appeared by Zoom video.  Attorney Mackenzie Christensen in court for Valangel Malorie Stinson.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
3:21 p.m.
Deft wishes to proceed w/Prelim.
ADA requests adjournment - Deft's video quality is too blurry for witness to identify Deft.
Court offers options for proceeding.
Atty Christiansen stipulates that Deft is person named in Complaint.
ADA calls Officer Daryl Booth, City of Marinette Police Dept - sworn in and examined.
Atty Christiansen cross-examines.
Atty Christiansen calls witness Detective Derrik Maye - sworn in and examined.
ADA cross-examines.
ADA makes argument.
Atty Christiansen makes argument.
Court finds probable cause.
Deft bound over for trial.
Arraignment already scheduled.
Atty Christiansen requests Zoom for Deft.
Court denies - Deft must appear in person.
3:36 p.m.
Instructions on How to Appear Remotely
Letter to Commissioner re Preliminary Hearing - ZOOM appearance APPROVED by CC
Atty Mackenzie Christensen appointed as Dean atty for Deft - repayment of $100 per week comm 9-1-22

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:41 AM Defendant Valangel Malorie Stinson in court.  Attorney Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Deft provides dean paperwork to the court.
Deft sworn in.
Atty Christensen is present and is heard - will take the case, pending a conflict check.
DA provides copy of complaint.
Court appoints Atty Christensen.
Deft to repay dean fees at $100 per month beginning 09-01-2022.
Atty Christensen heard.
Court reviews charges and max penalties.
Deft understands.
Atty Christensen requests prelim.
Court schedules.
9:46 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:14 AM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Valangel Malorie Stinson appeared by video, in custody. Att Spansail is present for bond purposes only. 
Court calls case. 
Copy of complaint. 
ADA spks on bond recommendation. 
Atty spks on bond recommendation. 
Court imposes: $1,500 cash bond with conditions: sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substance illegal in WI today, without a valid Rx and no operating a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license, 
Court schedules with parties. 
9:19 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
by R Sauve - Detained in Milwaukee County, Contact: Fox Point Police Department

9:38 AM Attorney Robert Mraz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Deft does not appear.
ADA heard - citation was given in person.
Requests bench warrant.
Court so orders.
9:39 AM
